author: Staff Reporter
text:
Bharatiya Janata Party’s (BJP) State vice president of Endowment cell was allegedly assaulted by a six unidentified persons near a temple in Vaniyambadi Town on Friday morning.

Sivaprakasam (60), a resident of Vaniyambadi, is also the party’s State council member. He had visited a Vinayagar temple in Vaniyambadi town at 7 a.m. When he came out of the temple after offering prayers, a six-member gang assaulted him using iron rods. The unidentified men had come in three motorbikes.

Sustained injuries

He sustained injuries, including on the head, leg and shoulder, in the attack. The attackers fled from the spot after he raised an alarm for help. Sivaprakasam was rushed to the Government Hospital, Vaniyambadi. He received 18 stitches for an injury on the head.

Following the attack, members of the party and Hindu organisations staged a protest near the Vaniyambadi bus stand condemning the attack. BJP’s national secretary H. Raja visited Sivaprakasam at the hospital and demanded immediate action from the police to arrest the culprits.

Police have registered a case and are investigating.
title: BJP functionary assaulted in Vaniyambadi
